intro: Sideroxylon politum, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a member of the Sapotaceae family. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to tropical Africa. The plant is characterized by its dense, hard wood that is highly valued for its durability and resistance to decay. Its leaves are typically opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth, glossy surface. Sideroxylon politum also produces small, yellowish flowers followed by spherical, woody fruits containing a single seed.
